title: Update your approved driving instructor (ADI) registration

details.description: Update your personal details on the approved driving instructor (ADI) register if they have changed
details.more_information:
The online service is available from 6am to 11:30pm.

You will need your:

  • online user ID from the Driving Standards Agency (DSA)
  • password

Your user ID and password

Your user ID can be found on all letters sent to you by DSA. It’s not the same as your ADI personal reference number.

You can email DSA if you’ve never had a user ID or have lost yours. You’ll need to include 2 of these in your email:

  • your ADI number
  • your driving licence number
  • your date of birth

DSA helpline

irdt@dsa.gsi.gov.uk

Rules for passwords

You have to change your password every 60 days. You can’t use any of your 5 previously used passwords.

Your password must be at least 9 characters long. It must include at least 3 of these 4 types of characters:

  • uppercase characters, eg A B C
  • lowercase characters, eg a b c
  • numeric digits, eg 1 2 3
  • special characters, eg £ % &

There’s a different process to update your ADI registration in Northern Ireland.
details.introduction: Update your personal details for your approved driving instructor (ADI) registration. You can also agree to keep your professional skills up to date, agree to the voluntary ADI code of practice, and view your check test history.
details.alternate_methods:
Update by email or phone

You can update your details by sending an email or calling DSA. You’ll need to give your ADI personal reference number.

DSA helpline adireg@dsa.gsi.gov.uk
0300 200 1122
Monday to Friday, 8am to 6pm

Update by post

Send a letter to DSA to update your details by post. You’ll need to include your ADI personal reference number.
